website_summaries.verdict: A fun way to introduce toddlers to snow sports, but they're pricey for skis not suited for downhill.
pros: Wide and stable ski base and pre-mounted bindings make it easy to attach to kids' winter boots
Colorful cartoon decorations allow kids to choose more personalized ski design
cons: Kids ages 4 and up will likely be too tall to comfortably use these
For skiing on flat areas only

customer_reviews.title: Kid did not like the bindings.
customer_reviews.text: This might be more of a review of my child, instead of the product. Started my two year old skiing this year. First time up we rented proper skis with bindings. He had a blast, was very balanced, and wanted his own pair. We ordered him this set thinking "whatever, he's not on the black diamond slopes, so ...." The quality of the set is excellent, and the poles are safe for toddler use. The problem is that the binding provide no support. I think my kid was actually using the bindings to lean against and balance. He couldn't stand up, ergo he hated these skis. If your kid can handle the bindings, this is a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin MTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: & 2) got these skis for Christmas and they are adorable! It was so fun to see them enjoy ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughters (ages 5, 4, & 2) got these skis for Christmas and they are adorable! It was so fun to see them enjoy winter! Especially because in Minnesota, we have A LOT of winter! I can see the girls spending lots of time around the yard and in the neighborhood park skiing. My two year old was able to pick it up quickly and had a blast! My five year old is tall for her age so the poles are a bit short, but it didn’t stop her from enjoying herself. These are perfect beginner skis to introduce a love of skiing and outdoor winter sports! Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect first skis for my 2 year old girl. Her feet are toddler size 5 (we use her boggs) and her boots fit in the binding straps with room to grow. The holes in the tips are great for pulling her (for balance learning) and can be strapped together when she she's ready to go down a small hill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for young toddlers and for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Our little one (16 months) went skiing for the first time on these recently. They are super easy to use, carry and store. His snow boots fit well and they have a pre-made hole in the tips so we added a string to keep his skis together. Only downside was that we pulled on one of the straps and the clip broke off. We were able to tie it and make it work. Hopefully it works again for next time!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great looking learning skis.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a very nice package for my 2 year old grandson. They arrived quickly. Can't test them out until the snow flies.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D. Sennewald

customer_reviews.title: Perfect start for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My 21 month old grandson spent two days enjoying the snow. He actually skied a tiny hill. These worked with regular snow boots as well as little ski boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good idea...it's not.
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would be a great way to get a 3 year old on skis and practicing in the yard. They are just too cumbersome to put on, stability is terrible, and they just didn't work out. I rented real boots and skis and she was up and running no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Niman

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler skis
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my little one to get used to skiing. They fit right over her regular snow boots with adjustable straps.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Amazing first pair of skis
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! These skis were the perfect introduction to our 15 month old getting used to being on skis. She loved it so much! Can’t wait for her to be back on them next winter!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my granddaughter. She's only three but had a great time with them. She's a little scared which is understandable but I think with practice she'll get a lot of use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with snow boots
customer_reviews.text: 4 year old granddaughter in Minneapolis loves the skis. Her mother is a skier & dad is a snowboarder.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but broke fast!
customer_reviews.text: Really fun for playing in the yard, but I just went to put them away for the winter and the binding broke. We only used them once this winter!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Bindings snapped within the first 10 minutes of use. Opened and returned in a 15 minute period.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: great product, our son is only slowly taking to skiing but when he's in the mood, he loves them!
customer_reviews.author: D. Wright

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: Love the design; these will be the perfect starter skis for my 2-year old granddaughter. Record arrival time, too; last gift ordered and first one delivered!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

Great to grab in place of a sledge for some super snow fun!
